subclassFeature.name: Oath of Acroamata
entries: Every Paladin answers a call, but while some are driven by their oath to a particular god or pantheon, the Acroamata are initiated into the secrets and mysteries of the source of Knowledge and Magic. These arcane protectors ensure that magic is used safely and prudently; some of them seek out and correct those who are reckless with their power. Some are dedicated guardians at universities and mages' guilds, others are loyal bodyguards of travelling wizards. Some are seekers of ancient magical relics. Whatever their calling, all know the power of arcane magic and that such power is dangerous.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Acroamata
entries: The Acroamatic Oath emphasizes the need for arcane power to be controlled and used properly.

entries.name: Keepeer of Knowledge.
entries: No magic should be forgotten. You must seek out arcane knowledge and preserve it.

entries.name: Bane of Fools.
entries: Magic is dangerous by nature. You are a foe of those who use it without caution or compassion.

entries.name: Protector of the Art.
entries: Be wise in your judgement. Be careful that knowledge does not fall into the wrong hands.

entries.name: Student of the Art.
entries: It is not enough to study magic, you must practice it. Devote yourself to the perfection of the Art.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells Variant: Spellbook
entries: Instead of gaining oath spells at the usual paladin levels, you instead gain the use of a small spellbook. When you take this oath at 3rd level, and again when you reach 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th level, you can add two spells of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard} to your spellbook for free. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the Paladin table. On your adventures, you might find other spells that you can add to your spellbook (see the {@class Wizard} class). All spells in your spellbook must come from the Wizard spell list, but they are Paladin spells for you.
When you prepare spells, choose any spells from the paladin spell list or your spellbook, and the number of spells you prepare is equal to your spellcasting modifier + your paladin level.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Spellbreaker
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike at an enemy's magical defenses. When you hit with a weapon attack, choose one type of damage resistance the target possesses. The resistance is suppressed and the target does not gain the benefit of that resistance until it completes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to protect yourself from magic. As a reaction to failing a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, you can use your Channel Divinity. You instead succeed on the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Rule - Arcane Casting:
entries: At the DM's discretion, at 3rd level when you take this oath, you may choose to use Intelligence or Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You may use any {@item Spell Scroll} or attune to any magic item available to a Wizard.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Rule - Arcane Smite:
entries: When you use Divine Smite, the extra damage is force damage. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} if the target is an aberration or a creature that has the Spellcasting or Innate Spellcasting trait.

subclassFeature.name: Afterimage
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can protect yourself and others from the deadly effects of uncontrolled magic. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to damage from spells.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Channel
entries: Beginning at 15th level, your Channel Divinity options can be used to greater effect.
When you use your Spellbreaker against an enemy with a damage immunity, you may choose any one resistance or immunity to be suppressed.
When you use your Magic Resistance after failing a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, you succeed on the saving throw and are also immune to all effects of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Inexorable Spellsword
entries: At 20th level, you gain the ability to unleash incredible arcane power. As an action, you can empower yourself until the end of your turn and for a number of additional rounds equal to your spellcasting modifier. You gain the following benefits:
If you use your action to cast a spell, you can make a single weapon attack as a bonus action.
When you cast a spell, any spell slot expended is regained when this ability expires.
You may cast one spell from the Wizard spell list of up to 7th level. The spell does not expend a spell slot and requires no somatic or verbal components.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
